original_title: Sri Lanka to tighten anti-money laundering framework
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka will tighten the country’s anti-money laundering and counter terrorism financing framework (AML/CFT) ahead of an impending assessment, and also comply with an International Monetary Fund program, President Ranil Wickremsinghe has said.
Closing gaps in the framework will also help comply with an International Monetary Fund program, he had said.
Sri Lanka will make sure that the country is not re-labelled as a location with ‘strategic deficiencies’ President Wickremesinghe had said.
“Such a designation could have severe adverse effects on the country’s economic development,” he had said.
Fixing the anti-money laundering framework will also help implement provisions of an IMF program.

The Companies Act will be amended to strengthen the beneficial ownership provisions relating to legal persons, the only remaining non-compliant item in recommendations made by a global Financial Action Task Force, according to the IMF program.
